title: Advanced Health Promotion Program Planning: Theory and Practice
description: Theory and methods to facilitate individual and group behavior change to promote health and prevent disease. Concepts from behavioral sciences, health behavior theory, motivation, and decision making. Development of planning and evaluation skills. Not open to students with credit in KINEÂ 434. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: KINE 503 or KINE 504 or KINE 510; graduate standing
